summary: This is an email chain from February 2019 between an Assistant U.S. Attorney and the chambers of Judge Sweet regarding the case 'v. Maxwell, et al., 15 Civ. 7433 (RWS)'. The correspondence involves the submission of a letter and an application with a proposed order, requesting that the application be filed under seal.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: The sender of the emails, submitting legal applications and a letter to Judge Sweet's chambers regarding the case against Maxwell.

persons.name: Judge Sweet
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case 'v. Maxwell, et al., 15 Civ. 7433 (RWS)', to whose chambers the legal correspondence is addressed.

connections.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Alex is submitting legal filings and correspondence to Judge Sweet's chambers in an official capacity.

events.title: Submission of Sealed Application
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Alex submits an application and proposed order to Judge Sweet's chambers, requesting it be filed under seal.

events.title: Follow-up Letter Submission
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Alex submits a follow-up letter in connection with a previous application to Judge Sweet's chambers.

keyFacts: The document is part of the case 'v. Maxwell, et al., 15 Civ. 7433 (RWS)', indicating ongoing legal proceedings against Ghislaine Maxwell and others.
The U.S. Attorney's Office is requesting that certain applications be filed under seal, suggesting sensitive information.
The correspondence shows procedural steps in the legal case, with filings submitted in February 2019.
The email chain indicates a correction or resubmission ('Same mistake as last time â€” apologies'), hinting at prior administrative errors in the filing process.
